title.narrative: OPT 4.1. CHILD AND EQUITY FOCUSED PUBLIC POLICIES, FINANCING AND MONITORING

description.narrative: National and sub-national capacities in the four departments receiving UNICEF support are strengthened for the implementation of child- and equity focused policies, efficient and effective use of social investment and the monitoring and reporting on the situation of children.

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers - social protection data management (management information system, social and beneficiary registries, M&E systems)
Public finance management in social protection
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

related-activity.ref: 0510/A0/05/404 OCM 4. EVERY CHILD HAS AN EQUAL CHANCE IN LIFE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and sub-national capacities in the four departments receiving UNICEF support are strengthened for the implementation of child- and equity focused policies, efficient and effective use of social investment and the monitoring and reporting on the situation of children.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued providing technical assistance to counterparts at both the national and sub-national levels to promote greater and more efficient allocation of resources and to incorporate children into national and sub-national planning and public policies developed at both levels of government. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of local governments with participation of children in their planning process
National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures

actual.value: 2019:The methodological document for measurement of multidimensional child poverty is in progress

title.narrative: Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children
Strengthened capacity of stakeholders in budgeting at all levels of government to improve spending outcomes for children

baseline.value: 58% of all municipalities received training in budgeting for children

target.value: 2021:80% of all municipalities received training in budgeting for children
